data.title: Contributions to the tribute of Edward G. O'Brien, Jr.
data.meta_description: Contributions to the tribute of Edward G. O'Brien, Jr..
data.text:
J

John McKenna posted a condolence

An absolute gentleman. I was with him on a trip to the hospital. It was a pleasure talking with Mr O'Brien about the American Legion, the military, my Dad and whatever else we could to make him comfortable. Rest in Peace Mr. O'Brien.

D

Divo Martini posted a condolence

I had the pleasure of working with Sgt. O'Brien in Troop 'C', Mounted Unit. He was always a gentleman and concerned for his officers. When we "retired" guys get together, we sometimes talk about our old bosses; Ed is always at the top of our "great guy" list. Sgt. Divo Martini (ret) Rest in Peace Ed.

B

Benjamin & Cynthia Kissling & Family posted a condolence

The Lord as wrapped His Arms around Edward G. O Brien Jr. and is watching all of us from above now. May we all young and old make Him proud of us as he watches us from above. The Lord is with Him. Love Benjamin, Cynthia, McKaylah, Taza, Dyonna

S

Sandy Granelli posted a condolence

Ed, Cathy, Morgan, Liam and Family, My thoughts and prayers are with you all at this time. My you find comfort that he is no longer suffering and is in heaven with our lord. Sandy Granelli

M

Mark Kirkland posted a condolence

To the O'Brien family: So sorry to hear of your loss, as I am just getting over the loss of my mother earlier this month. Ed, if there is anything I can do, or if you want to talk, don't hesitate to ask.

Jennifer(Porter)Sarubbi posted a condolence

My heart hurts for all of the O'Brien's. What a loss of a wonderful man,father,husband and grandfather. I will always remember Mr."O" smiling. I don't think in all the many years I knew him,I ever saw him with anything but a BIG HAPPY smile on his face. He will be missed by many. Love,Jen Porter

K

Kitty Reinertsen posted a condolence

Was a pleasure to know your Dad for my entire life. What a great couple. Always with that fabulous Irish smile. So kind to my mother, they met at the Chapel at the VA on Sundays. A life well lived. May he rest in peace.
